Package template.xml

Class XmlWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.io.Writer
      • java.io.BufferedWriter
        • template.xml.XmlWriter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, Flushable, Appendable, AutoCloseable
    public class XmlWriter
extends BufferedWriter
    Writes data (usually of an object) to a XML file. Note: it is the callers responsibility to close() the XmlWriter.
    Author:
    Heinz Silberbauer

    • Constructor Detail

      • XmlWriter

        public XmlWriter​(String fileName,
                 boolean verbose)
          throws IOException
        Instantiates a new xml writer to make something persistent. Uses stand alone writing without complexity: no DTD or XML schema, UTF-8 character encoding.
        Parameters:
        fileName - the file name of the XML file
        verbose - true if the XML writer should create verbose information in the XML file to make it more human readable, false otherwise
        Throws:
        IOException - an I/O exception has occurred

      • XmlWriter

        public XmlWriter​(String fileName,
                 String xmlDefinitonLine,
                 boolean verbose)
          throws IOException
        Instantiates a new xml writer to make something persistent. The caller decides about the XML definition line(s), e.g. a XML schema, or a DTD.
        Parameters:
        fileName - the file name of the XML file
        verbose - true if the XML writer should create verbose information in the XML file to make it more human readable, false otherwise
        Throws:
        IOException - an I/O exception has occurred

      • indentMore

        public void indentMore()
        Increase the indentation level by one.

      • setIndentString

        public void setIndentString​(String indentString)
        Sets the indent string used for indenting the XML output to get it formatted. This is usually either an empty string or null to avoid additional characters in the XML output, a tab character or some blanks.

        If setIndentString is not called before writing the XML output, the default is the tab character.

        Parameters:
        indentString - the string used for one indent level
